intro: Hoya australis subsp. oramicola, commonly known as the silver star hoya, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that often have a silvery or whitish hue. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is a popular houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements. Hoya australis subsp. oramicola thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil.
